question: [File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Field: user_txn_filter] [Large Payload] If user_txn_filter contains PayloadFilter::DirectMempool with millions of TransactionSummary entries, can this cause stack overflow when passed by value? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Field: exclude_authors] [HashSet Growth] Can an attacker continuously add authors to exclude_authors causing unbounded HashSet growth and memory exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Struct: PayloadPullParameters] [Stack Size] Is PayloadPullParameters size reasonable for stack allocation, or can large embedded structures (PayloadFilter, HashSet) cause stack overflow in deep call chains? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Struct: OptQSPayloadPullParams] [Missing Serde] Since OptQSPayloadPullParams doesn't derive Serialize/Deserialize, can this prevent proper network transmission and cause validators to have inconsistent OptQS parameters? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Struct: PayloadPullParameters] [Missing Serde] Since PayloadPullParameters doesn't derive Serialize/Deserialize, how are these parameters propagated across network boundaries without serialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Fields: max_txns and max_txns_after_filtering] [Bytes vs Count Mismatch] Can max_txns.count() < max_txns_after_filtering but max_txns.size_in_bytes() > expected bytes cause inconsistent filtering where transaction count is accepted but total size is rejected? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Fields: max_inline_txns and max_txns] [Bytes Constraint] If max_inline_txns.size_in_bytes() > max_txns.size_in_bytes(), can this cause payload construction to fail when trying to fit inline transactions within total limits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Field: minimum_batch_age_usecs] [Clock Skew Attack] Can a Byzantine validator with a skewed system clock exploit minimum_batch_age_usecs validation by having their batches appear older/younger than they actually are? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Field: exclude_authors] [Denial of Service] Can a malicious proposer exclude all active batch producers through exclude_authors, forcing the network to operate with empty blocks and degraded throughput? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Struct: OptQSPayloadPullParams] [Optional Bypass] When maybe_optqs_payload_pull_params is None, are there fallback exclusion mechanisms, or can this allow banned authors to participate in payload contribution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Field: max_txns_after_filtering] [Saturating Arithmetic] Are operations with max_txns_after_filtering using saturating arithmetic, or can unchecked additions/subtractions with transaction counts cause overflow/underflow? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Field: minimum_batch_age_usecs] [u64 Wraparound] Can wraparound from u64::MAX to 0 in timestamp calculations with minimum_batch_age_usecs cause ancient batches to appear as recent? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Field: user_txn_filter] [Filter Consistency] If user_txn_filter is PayloadFilter::InQuorumStore with batch references, can these batches become invalid between parameter construction and usage, causing filter mismatches? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Field: user_txn_filter] [Clone Semantics] When user_txn_filter.clone() is called in the polling loop, does this deep clone all transaction summaries or batch info, potentially causing stale filter data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Field: user_txn_filter] [Empty Filter] Can PayloadFilter::Empty be set maliciously to bypass filtering for batches that should have been excluded based on previous proposals? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Fields: max_poll_time and pending_ordering] [Timing Manipulation] Can a Byzantine validator manipulate max_poll_time in coordination with pending_ordering to cause some validators to timeout while others successfully pull payloads? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Field: block_timestamp] [Future Timestamp] Can setting block_timestamp far in the future (beyond current time + max_poll_time) cause confusion in payload age calculations that breaks batch selection? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Fields: pending_ordering and pending_uncommitted_blocks] [State Transition] Can incorrect state transitions where pending_ordering changes but pending_uncommitted_blocks doesn't update cause validators to make conflicting decisions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Field: recent_max_fill_fraction] [State Poisoning] Can an attacker manipulate recent_max_fill_fraction through carefully crafted sequences of full/empty blocks to permanently poison the fill fraction metric? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Field: soft_max_txns_after_filtering] [Upper Bound] Is soft_max_txns_after_filtering validated against blockchain capacity limits, or can it be set arbitrarily high causing resource exhaustion in downstream processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Field: pending_uncommitted_blocks] [Negative Logic] Since pending_uncommitted_blocks is usize (unsigned), are there implicit assumptions about it never being 'negative' that could be violated through wraparound? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Integration: Multiple Validators] [Non-Determinism] Can differences in how multiple validators construct PayloadPullParameters (due to slightly different local state) cause them to pull different payloads for the same round? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Integration: Epoch Boundaries] [Parameter Continuity] During epoch transitions, can stale PayloadPullParameters from the previous epoch be used, causing new validators to operate with incorrect exclusion lists or limits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [Integration: Reconfiguration] [Parameter Propagation] When consensus configuration changes, is PayloadPullParameters updated atomically across all validators, or can propagation delays cause temporary inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/consensus-types/src/payload_pull_params.rs] [All Fields] [Default Values] If PayloadPullParameters is instantiated using Default trait (if available), are the default values safe for consensus operation, or could default parameters cause immediate failures? (Medium)
